"**Driven by You** " is a song by [Queen](/wiki/Queen_\(band\) "Queen
\(band\)")'s lead guitarist [Brian May](/wiki/Brian_May "Brian May"). It was
written as part of his 1992 solo album, _[Back to the
Light](/wiki/Back_to_the_Light "Back to the Light")_. It was released as a
[single](/wiki/Single_\(music\) "Single \(music\)") in late 1991, peaking at
#6 on the [UK Singles Chart](/wiki/UK_Singles_Chart "UK Singles Chart") and #9
on the [US Mainstream Rock Tracks Chart](/wiki/Hot_Mainstream_Rock_Tracks "Hot
Mainstream Rock Tracks").[1]

Besides the original album/single version, there are three other known studio
versions of the song. One was used in a [Ford](/wiki/Ford_Motor_Company "Ford
Motor Company") commercial. The second is an [instrumental](/wiki/Instrumental
"Instrumental") remix of the song, called _Driven by You Two_. The other known
version of this song has a new drum track from [Cozy Powell](/wiki/Cozy_Powell
"Cozy Powell") as a bonus track on the US release of _Back to the Light_.

Shortly before releasing it as single, May played it on the [Guitar Legends
concert](/wiki/Guitar_Legends,_Seville_1991 "Guitar Legends, Seville 1991") in
October 1991, having a super-group backing him: [Cozy
Powell](/wiki/Cozy_Powell "Cozy Powell") on drums, [Neil
Murray](/wiki/Neil_Murray_\(British_musician\) "Neil Murray \(British
musician\)") on bass, [Steve Vai](/wiki/Steve_Vai "Steve Vai") on rhythm
guitar, [Rick Wakeman](/wiki/Rick_Wakeman "Rick Wakeman") and [Mike
Moran](/wiki/Mike_Moran_\(music_producer\) "Mike Moran \(music producer\)") on
keyboards, [Maggie Ryder](/wiki/Maggie_Ryder "Maggie Ryder"), [Miriam
Stockley](/wiki/Miriam_Stockley "Miriam Stockley") and [Chris
Thompson](/wiki/Chris_Thompson_\(English_musician\) "Chris Thompson \(English
musician\)") on backing vocals. Many fans think this song is dedicated to
[Freddie Mercury](/wiki/Freddie_Mercury "Freddie Mercury") because of the
lyrics and the song title Driven by You.

It was released on 6 November 1991, just 18 days before the death of May's
bandmate [Freddie Mercury](/wiki/Freddie_Mercury "Freddie Mercury").

It was used by the Ford Motor Company in advertisements for the [Ford
Probe](/wiki/Ford_Probe "Ford Probe") and for the [Ford Escort RS
Cosworth](/wiki/Ford_Escort_RS_Cosworth "Ford Escort RS Cosworth"), in which
[Miki Biasion](/wiki/Miki_Biasion "Miki Biasion") (a Ford rally driver at the
time) compared his rally car to the road-going version.
